subject: Re: [junit] Re: Mock objects...
msgSnippet: Hope it works out for you. We ve been pretty negligent in terms of providing doc, but that s the price of keeping the day job ;-). In the meantime J.B. is
messageBody:
Hope it works out for you. We've been pretty negligent in terms of
providing doc, but that's the price of keeping the day job ;-). In the
meantime J.B. is providing good cover.

One thing that's missing from this discussion is the notion that mocks
are a /design/ technique. You should use them to help you discover an
object's neighbours, you can test the interactions before the objects
exist. Write the object under test as if it had the neighbouring objects
it needs, using mocks to implement them, then implement the neighbours.
Rinse and repeat (remembering to write some integration tests to glue
the whole thing together). You should find this pushes you towards
smaller focussed objects and interfaces which some of us think is a Good
Thing.

Steve

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> cypherfox wrote:
>>jMock is *definitely* my weekend study project.
> I added value. That's always my goal. Good luck, and we're here if you
> have questions.
